conclusion: To determine if the two objects have the same acceleration at time \( t_1 \), analyze the velocity-time graphs for objects A and B.

The image shows velocity-time graphs for two objects, A and B. Object A's velocity increases linearly from 0 to a maximum value over time \( t_1 \) to \( t_2 \), then decreases linearly back to 0 by \( t_4 \). Object B's velocity increases from 0 to a maximum value over a longer time period from \( t_1 \) to \( t_4 \).
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time, calculated as the slope of the tangent to the velocity-time graph at a given time.
At time \( t_1 \), for object A, the velocity is increasing, so the slope of the tangent is positive.
At time \( t_1 \), for object B, the velocity is also increasing, so the slope of the tangent is positive.

The acceleration of object A at \( t_1 \) is determined by the slope of its graph at that time. Similarly, the acceleration of object B at \( t_1 \) is determined by the slope of its graph at that time.
By comparing these slopes, we can determine if the accelerations are the same at time \( t_1 \).
Since both objects have a positive slope at \( t_1 \), their accelerations are equal.
